name: substitutable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
able to be used instead of another thing or person: substitutable for Canned fruit may be substitutable for fresh fruit in some recipes. For many applications, the two types of board are readily substitutable.
More examplesFewer examplesThis deep local expertise means that farmers aren't disposable and substitutable resources. All of these products are easily substitutable with whatever your own preferred brand may be.The implicit assumption is that the various forms of healthcare provision are entirely substitutable.Consumers looked for substitutable sources of energy.
